title-group.article-title: Predicting Future Spot Rates on the Basis of Forward Rates—A Time Series Approach

abstract.p: The question whether forward rates are usable tools for predicting spot rates has received considerable attention in the literature. Frequently, the question has been formalized to the problem of bias in the corresponding forecasts. Often, a regression model has been used to evaluate this bias. There are, however, strong prior arguments against the use of regression analysis. Moreover, the presence of bias does not disqualify the forward rate as a usable predictor. Theoretically, the complete Joint distribution of the errors should be analyzed. Univariate analysis of these errors may be a useful method of analysis. Ten currencies were considered. For three months contracts, the time series models performed as poorly as forward rates. For one month contracts, not only the overall performance was better, but also time series predictors largely outperformed forward rates.
